comment._content:
General Aureliano Blanquet

Date in reverse is hard to read, 11/1/13?

comment.author: 31580040@N04
comment._content: @ Richard Arthur Norton (1958) There's a Spanish Wikipedia page es.wikipedia.org/wiki/Aureliano_Blanquet that you might find useful, if you can read Spanish (I can't).

comment.author: 53461717@N08
comment._content:
Este es el Gen. Aureliano Blanquet quien arrestó al Presidente Francisco I. Madero por órdenes de Victoriano Huerta, en febrero de 1913. Al momento del arresto Madero le dijo a Blanquet: "es Usted un traidor".
Dr. Roberto Duarte

comment.author: 53461717@N08
comment._content: Found in Wikipedia In October 1913 dictator Victoriano Huerta dissolved the federal congress and prepared for a rigged referendum to legitimize himself as the President, with Blanquet named as vice-president.[6]. This picture is scratch-dated one month later. Was it taken as vice-president? In picture hdl.loc.gov/loc.pnp/ggbain.14712 Probably taken on November 15, 1913, Blanquet does not appear in Huerta's cabinet. However in www.inehrm.gob.mx/Portal/PtMain.php?pagina=exp-renuncia-v... I found Aureliano Blanquet fue uno de los hombres más cercanos a Huerta, su brazo fuerte; ocupó el cargo de Ministro de Guerra y Marina del 13 de junio de 1913 al 10 de julio de 1914. General del Ejército Aureliano Blanquet. Imagen tomada de: Gustavo Casasola, Historia gráfica de la revolución mexicana, 1900-1970, t. 3, México, Trillas, 1973, p. 751.
